descr: "The ServiceDefinition describes a unit of decision support functionality that is made available as a service, such as immunization modules or drug-drug interaction checking."

fields.name: resourceType
fields.descr: "This is a ServiceDefinition resource"

fields.name: url
fields.descr: "An absolute URI that is used to identify this service definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance. This SHALL be a URL, SHOULD be globally unique, and SHOULD be an address at which this service definition is (or will be) published. The URL SHOULD include the major version of the service definition. For more information see [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions)."

fields.name: identifier
fields.descr: "A formal identifier that is used to identify this service definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance. This is used for CMS or NQF identifiers for a measure artifact. Note that at least one identifier is required for non-experimental active artifacts."

fields.name: version
fields.descr: "The identifier that is used to identify this version of the service definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the service definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence."

fields.name: name
fields.descr: "A natural language name identifying the service definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation."

fields.name: title
fields.descr: "A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the service definition."

fields.name: status
fields.descr: "The status of this service definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content."

fields.name: experimental
fields.descr: "A boolean value to indicate that this service definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage."

fields.name: date
fields.descr: "The date  (and optionally time) when the service definition was published. The date must change if and when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the service definition changes."

fields.name: publisher
fields.descr: "The name of the individual or organization that published the service definition."

fields.name: description
fields.descr: "A free text natural language description of the service definition from a consumer's perspective."

fields.name: purpose
fields.descr: "Explaination of why this service definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has."

fields.name: usage
fields.descr: "A detailed description of how the module is used from a clinical perspective."

fields.name: approvalDate
fields.descr: "The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage."

fields.name: lastReviewDate
fields.descr: "The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval, but doesn't change the original approval date."

fields.name: effectivePeriod
fields.descr: "The period during which the service definition content was or is planned to be in active use."

fields.name: useContext
fields.descr: "The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These terms may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate service definition instances."

fields.name: jurisdiction
fields.descr: "A legal or geographic region in which the service definition is intended to be used."

fields.name: topic
fields.descr: "Descriptive topics related to the module. Topics provide a high-level categorization of the module that can be useful for filtering and searching."

fields.name: contributor
fields.descr: "A contributor to the content of the module, including authors, editors, reviewers, and endorsers."

fields.name: contact
fields.descr: "Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher."

fields.name: copyright
fields.descr: "A copyright statement relating to the service definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the service definition."

fields.name: relatedArtifact
fields.descr: "Related resources such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references."

fields.name: trigger
fields.descr: "The trigger element defines when the rule should be invoked. This information is used by consumers of the rule to determine how to integrate the rule into a specific workflow."

fields.name: dataRequirement
fields.descr: "Data requirements are a machine processable description of the data required by the module in order to perform a successful evaluation."

fields.name: operationDefinition
fields.descr: "A reference to the operation that is used to invoke this service."

fields.name: text
fields.descr:
"A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it \"clinically safe\" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: contained
fields.descr:
"These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: extension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: modifierExtension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: id
fields.descr:
"The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: meta
fields.descr:
"The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: implicitRules
fields.descr:
"A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: language
fields.descr:
"The base language in which the resource is written."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource
